text: Greetings everyone. I have a question about updating custom modules.  I've created many for a client that are all working fine. They have asked for some small edits and tweaks.  To my shock, they say that when a module is updated (in any way it seems) that all the content in existing pages is LOST!!!  (the content reverts to default content) Now surely that has to be a bug or screw up by me, otherwise how can dev's maintain modules?  I said I would ask you knowledable people here. *My question is: if you update a custom module, by changing code or adding a new field, will it reset all content in existing pages that contain the module?*  :fearful: and if that shouldn't happen what do you think the reason could be?

I can think in two main reasons why it could been lost:
- Slug of fields/groups changed. (like you wrapped your fields in a new group the slug will change and the content will be lost like `group_slug.field`
- Remove the CM and add it back to the template or in the content editor. I believe the internal ID associated will change each time you do this and therefor the content is lost
Another reason is an error in the custom module that the module validation didn't catch.

Thanks for reply <@U7ADCU3BM>. So it shouldn't happen then.  So if I add a new field, (leaving the exiting intact) would that break the module? And if I make a change just to the CSS part, that should be OK?

Yeah I think that should be fine.
If something breaks, I believe support should be able to revert to a prev status and maybe find the cause.
Tho, if you have issues with that portal, I suggest you do some extra tests with dummy pages and CMs before

So Could any one help me regarding this Problem.
Could you elaborate on what you feel is not organized or clear on that page? Would love to know so we can improve it.
Basically, This form will be outside from HubSpot Environment i.e  any other external environment (not on HubSpot ) And It Looks like  the Image which I have attached.

And while copying the HTML file file from form I am only getting this type of Code.
How do I know which tags comes under which div or Class/ID.

It should be nearly an identical html structure with the same class names and everything, as in that page. I am recreating the form from that page to test.

regardless, you can add your own css class either using the embed code customizations or put a div around the embed code and style based on that divâ€™s class or id
